metadata.name: Apo digoxin 40 mg Injection powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Sulpiride is indicated for the treatment of schizophrenia

contraindications.disease: Although sulpiride has a low potential for causing acute toxicity substantial amounts of the drug may cause severe but reversible dystonic crises which may be associated with torticollis protrusion of the tongue and or trism Oversedation coma and classical symptoms typical of severe Parkinson s Disease may also be observed
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Sulpiride is a substituted benzamide derivative and a selective dopamine D2 antagonist with antipsychotic and antidepressant activity Other benzamide derivatives include metoclopramide tiapride and sultopride
